SamplePower Module¶

class havoc.autoval.lib.power.sample_power.HscPinAvg[source]¶

Bases: object

These constants are meant for the set_hsc_pin_avg_value() function. These are the number of samples to be averaged during EIN collection.

DISABLE_AVERAGING = '0x00'¶
SAMPLES_128 = '0x07'¶
SAMPLES_16 = '0x04'¶
SAMPLES_2 = '0x01'¶
SAMPLES_32 = '0x05'¶
SAMPLES_4 = '0x02'¶
SAMPLES_64 = '0x06'¶
SAMPLES_8 = '0x03'¶
class havoc.autoval.lib.power.sample_power.SamplePower(host, use_inband)[source]¶

Bases: object

__init__(host, use_inband)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

abort_collecting_samples()[source]¶
begin_sampling_power(ival_time, num_samples)[source]¶
ival_time - Interval time between samples. Must be from [0, 255].

Units are 0.25 seconds.

num_samples - Must be from [0, 65535].

free_memory()[source]¶
get_current_num_samples()[source]¶

Returns the number of samples that have been collected since the most recently started sample collection began.

get_power_samples(sample_offset, num_samples, buffer_time=1800)[source]¶

Blocks until the most recently started sample collection has finished collecting all samples.

sample_offset - Offset from the first sample that you want to begin

reading samples from. For example, an offset of 0 means start reading from the first sample. Offset of 3 means start from the fourth sample. Must be from [0, num_samples_read - 1].

num_samples - Number of samples to read starting at the sample_offset.

Must be [0, 255]

returns - a list of the samples in decimal form. Samples are in order.

Units are watts.

set_hsc_pin_avg_value(num_samples)[source]¶

Set HSC PIN Averaging value during EIN Collection. num_samples - Use one of the constants from the

HscPinAvg class.
